name: Prithvi Narayan Shah
summary: Prithvi Narayan Shah unified dozens of warring hill principalities and laid the foundation of modern Nepal, launching the Shah monarchy and a unified Himalayan kingdom.

name: Pratap Singh Shah
summary: Pratap Singh Shah, the eldest son of Prithvi Narayan Shah, ruled only two turbulent years before his untimely death left the young kingdom to his brother.

name: Rana Bahadur Shah
summary: Rana Bahadur Shah ascended as a child, presided over intense court intrigues, and famously abdicated in 1799 to live as an ascetic before plunging the court back into crisis.

name: Girvan Yuddha Bikram Shah
summary: Girvan Yuddha Bikram Shah reigned during Nepal's territorial zenith and the Anglo-Nepalese War, which ended with the Sugauli Treaty and major land losses.

name: Rajendra Bikram Shah
summary: Rajendra Bikram Shah's era saw rising Rana dominance as the monarchy ceded real power to hereditary prime ministers controlling Nepal's administration.

name: Surendra Bikram Shah
summary: Surendra Bikram Shah reigned under Jung Bahadur Rana's tight control, symbolising a Shah monarch reduced to ceremony while the Rana regime ruled outright.

name: Prithvi Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Prithvi Bir Bikram Shah encouraged early modernisation, opening Nepal's first college and hospital even as the Rana oligarchy retained political control.

name: Tribhuvan Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Tribhuvan Bir Bikram Shah sided with democratic forces to topple the Rana regime in 1951, paving the way for a constitutional monarchy in Nepal.

name: Mahendra Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Mahendra Bir Bikram Shah dissolved parliament, introduced the partyless Panchayat system, and centralised power while investing in roads and nation-building projects.

name: Birendra Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Birendra Bir Bikram Shah shepherded Nepal from absolute monarchy to multiparty democracy, promulgating the 1990 constitution after a nationwide movement.

name: Dipendra Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Dipendra Bir Bikram Shah technically reigned for three days while in a coma after the 2001 royal massacre that shocked Nepal and the world.

name: Gyanendra Bir Bikram Shah
summary: Gyanendra Bir Bikram Shah was Nepal's last monarch; his royal takeover amid the civil war hastened the abolition of the monarchy in 2008.
